intro: Coffea mufindiensis subsp. mufindiensis, commonly known as the Mufindi coffee. It is a rare and endemic species native to the highlands of southern Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, red berries containing two seeds. It is primarily cultivated for its coffee beans, which are known for their unique flavor profile. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable but threatened species in the wild.
